title: Gold Beach Municipal Airport
text:
Gold Beach Municipal Airport is a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located in <a href="Gold%20Beach%2C%20Oregon">Gold Beach</a>, a city in <a href="Curry%20County%2C%20Oregon">Curry County, Oregon</a>, United States. It is owned by the Port of Gold Beach. This airport is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Gold Beach Municipal Airport covers an area of 48 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (19 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 20 feet (6 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 16/34 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 3,237 by 75 feet (987 x 23 m).
For the 12-month period ending June 1, 2010, the airport had 5,550 aircraft operations, an average of 15 per day: 83% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>, 14% <a href="air%20taxi">air taxi</a>, and 3% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>.
At that time there were 13 aircraft based at this airport: 92% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> and 8% <a href="ultralight">ultralight</a>.
